newsitem.title: UK: NWE gas oil flat as premiums, futures stagnate.
newsitem.headline: NWE gas oil flat as premiums, futures stagnate.

text.p: NWE gas oil was flat to slightly weaker on Wednesday as benchmark IPE futures stagnated and premiums remained unchanged, traders said.
June IPE gas oil was flat at $161.50 a tonne at 1152 GMT as was the July contract at $162.75 a tonne.
Heating oil barges traded at June IPE +$1.0 a tonne fob Rotterdam for refinery material for delivery up to June 25. Storage material was talked around June IPE +25-50 cents/+75 cents fob ARA.
Interest for first half June delivery material was dwindling with just two working days left.
Some sellers were looking to get premiums of around June IPE +$1.25-$1.50 for second half June material on the basis of the contango into July, but buyers were only bidding around 75 cents.
Cargo premiums were little changed with 0.2 percent cargoes talked at June IPE flat/+$1.00 cif NWE.
Low diesel material, meanwhile, was talked at June IPE +$5.0/+$7.0.

Traders said the market continued to be under pressure from Med cargoes despite the fact that some players appeared to be putting a fair amount of wintergrade material into storage because of the contango. -- London Newsroom, +44 171 542 7714
